title: Episode 5-2 Highlights | Kim Soo-hyun × Kim Ji-won, The Couple Who Inevitably Drifted Apart
synopsis: A flashback reveals how Hyun-woo and Hye-in's marriage fell apart. He tells his friend he can't go inside—being near her makes him lose his mind, but not in a good way anymore. Hye-in clears out the baby items, a painful reminder of the child they'll never have. She moves to a separate room. When she waits outside all night for him to come home, she denies it fiercely—'I'm not the type to wait for anyone.' His response cuts deep: 'I know better than anyone you're not that kind of person.'

contents.original: 너도 정신 차리고 얼른 들어가.
contents.pronunciation: Neo-do jeongsin charigo eolleun deureoga.
contents.translation: You snap out of it too and hurry inside.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to snap out of it/get a grip'
grammar.example: 정신 차리고 = snap out of it and
얼른 들어가 = hurry inside

contents.culture: This is a flashback scene—Hyun-woo's friend telling him to go back inside to his wife.

contents.original: 내가 정신을 차리려고 나온 거야.
contents.pronunciation: Naega jeongsin-eul chariryeogo naon geoya.
contents.translation: I came out TO get a grip.

grammar.example: 차리려고 나온 거야 = I came out to get a grip

contents.original: 들어가면 정신이 하나도 없다고.
contents.pronunciation: Deureogamyeon jeongsin-i hanado eopdago.
contents.translation: When I'm inside, I completely lose it.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to be overwhelmed/lose one's mind'
grammar.example: 정신이 하나도 없다 = completely lose it

contents.culture: Double meaning—in the past (this flashback), being around Hye-in drove him crazy in a bad way. Now (present), it's driving him crazy with rekindled feelings.

contents.original: 들어가면 왜 정신이 없어?
contents.pronunciation: Deureogamyeon wae jeongsin-i eopseo?
contents.translation: Why do you lose it when you go inside?

grammar.example: 왜 정신이 없어 = why do you lose it

contents.original: 몰라, 그냥 정신이 없어.
contents.pronunciation: Molla, geunyang jeongsin-i eopseo.
contents.translation: I don't know, I just lose it.

grammar.example: 몰라 = I don't know

contents.original: 어디?
contents.pronunciation: Eodi?
contents.translation: Where are you?

grammar.example: 어디? = where?

contents.culture: Hye-in's text message asking where Hyun-woo is.

contents.original: 뭐 하는 거야, 문자 안 보고. 어? 봤어.
contents.pronunciation: Mwo haneun geoya, munja an bogo. Eo? Bwasseo.
contents.translation: What are you doing, not reading texts. Huh? I saw it.

grammar.example: 문자 안 보고 = not reading texts

contents.original: 먼저 자.
contents.pronunciation: Meonjeo ja.
contents.translation: Go to sleep first.

grammar.example: 먼저 자 = sleep first

contents.original: 먼저 자? 자라고, 먼저? 나 혼자야?
contents.pronunciation: Meonjeo ja? Jarago, meonjeo? Na honjaya?
contents.translation: Sleep first? You're telling me to sleep first? Alone?

grammar.example: 자라고 = you're telling me to sleep?
나 혼자야? = alone?

contents.culture: Hye-in's hurt and disbelief—her husband is telling her to sleep alone.

contents.original: 그래, 먼저 자라잖아. 자자, 먼저 자.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae, meonjeo jarajana. Jaja, meonjeo ja.
contents.translation: Yeah, I said sleep first. Go on, sleep first.

grammar.example: 자라잖아 = I'm telling you to sleep

contents.original: 아, 피한 거 맞네. 왜? 내가 뭐, 지를 잡아먹어? 내가 무서워?
contents.pronunciation: A, pihan geo manne. Wae? Naega mwo, jireul jabameogeo? Naega museowo?
contents.translation: Ah, so he IS avoiding me. Why? Am I going to eat her alive? Is she scared of me?

grammar.example: 피한 거 맞네 = he IS avoiding
잡아먹어? = am I going to eat her?

contents.original: 시끄러워. 내가 뭐가 무서워? 어디 가, 어딜?
contents.pronunciation: Sikkeureowo. Naega mwoga museowo? Eodi ga, eodil?
contents.translation: Shut up. Why would I be scared? Where are you going?

grammar.example: 시끄러워 = shut up

contents.original: 야, 이 동네 개들도 안 짖는다. 우리도 이제 들어가서 자자.
contents.pronunciation: Ya, i dongne gae-deul-do an jitneunda. Uri-do ije deureogaseo jaja.
contents.translation: Hey, even the neighborhood dogs aren't barking anymore. Let's go inside and sleep too.

grammar.example: 개들도 안 짖는다 = even dogs aren't barking

contents.culture: It's extremely late at night—even dogs have stopped barking.

contents.original: 나는 좀 더 있다가.
contents.pronunciation: Na-neun jom deo itdaga.
contents.translation: I'll stay a bit longer.

grammar.example: 좀 더 있다가 = after staying a bit more

contents.original: 제수씨 혼자 자겠다. 응, 그러니까. 나 혜인이 자면 들어가려고.
contents.pronunciation: Jesu-ssi honja jagetda. Eung, geureonikka. Na Hyein-i jamyeon deureogaryeogo.
contents.translation: Your wife is going to sleep alone. Yeah, exactly. I'll go in once Hye-in falls asleep.

grammar.example: 제수씨 혼자 = your wife alone
혜인이 자면 = when Hye-in sleeps

contents.original: 아이씨, 제수씨 또. 왜, 왜 제수씨 자면 들어가?
contents.pronunciation: Aissi, jesu-ssi tto. Wae, wae jesu-ssi jamyeon deureoga?
contents.translation: Geez, your wife again. Why, why do you go in when she falls asleep?

grammar.example: 아이씨 = geez/damn

contents.original: 아, 내가 사고 칠까 봐.
contents.pronunciation: A, naega sago chilkka bwa.
contents.translation: Because I might cause trouble.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to cause trouble/make a mistake'
grammar.example: 사고 칠까 봐 = worried I might cause trouble

contents.original: 뭔 소리야. 사고는 술 마시면 치는 거고 사고치기 싫으면 술을 마시지 말아야지.
contents.pronunciation: Mwon soriya. Sago-neun sul masimyeon chineun geogo sagochigi sireumyeon sur-eul masiji marayaji.
contents.translation: What are you talking about? You cause trouble when you drink. If you don't want trouble, don't drink.

grammar.example: 마시지 말아야지 = shouldn't drink

contents.original: 아니, 나는 술 마시고 뻗어야 사고를 안 칠 것 같아.
contents.pronunciation: Ani, na-neun sul masigo ppeo-deoya sago-reul an chil geot gata.
contents.translation: No, I think I need to drink and pass out to NOT cause trouble.

grammar.example: 술 마시고 뻗어야 = need to drink and pass out

contents.culture: Hyun-woo's twisted logic—he needs to be unconscious to avoid doing something he might regret with Hye-in.

contents.original: 난 네 말을 대체적으로 잘 이해를 못하겠어.
contents.pronunciation: Nan ne mar-eul daechejeogeuro jal ihae-reul mothagetsseo.
contents.translation: I generally don't understand what you're saying.

grammar.example: 대체적으로 잘 이해를 못하겠어 = I generally can't understand

contents.original: 형 잘 들어. 나는 지금부터 술을 더 마실 거야. 그리고 인사불성이 될 거야.
contents.pronunciation: Hyeong jal deureo. Na-neun jigeum-buteo sur-eul deo masil geoya. Geurigo insabulseong-i doel geoya.
contents.translation: Listen carefully, hyung. From now on, I'm going to drink more. And I'm going to get completely wasted.

grammar.example: 인사불성이 될 거야 = I'll become unconscious

contents.culture: 인사불성 (人事不省) - literally 'unable to recognize people,' meaning blackout drunk.

contents.original: 형은 이것만 명심해 줘. 뭐? 절대 나를 방에 넣지 마.
contents.pronunciation: Hyeong-eun igeotman myeongsimhae jwo. Mwo? Jeoldae na-reul bang-e neochi ma.
contents.translation: Just remember this one thing, hyung. What? Never put me in the room.

grammar.example: 명심해 줘 = remember this
절대 넣지 마 = never put me

contents.culture: The pivotal request—Hyun-woo asking his friend to keep him away from Hye-in's room no matter what.

contents.original: 저 방 치우는 거야? 나도 필요가 있어? 눈에 보이면 짜증이나 나지.
contents.pronunciation: Jeo bang chiuneun geoya? Na-do pilyo-ga isseo? Nun-e boimyeon jjajeung-ina naji.
contents.translation: Are you clearing out that room? Is there any need? It just irritates me when I see it.

grammar.example: 방 치우는 거야 = are you clearing the room
짜증이나 나지 = it just irritates me

contents.culture: Hye-in is clearing out baby items—a painful reminder of the child they'll never have due to her illness.

contents.original: 짜증이 나? 필요도 없잖아, 이제.
contents.pronunciation: Jjajeung-i na? Pilyo-do eobjana, ije.
contents.translation: It irritates you? There's no need for them anymore, anyway.

grammar.example: 필요도 없잖아 = there's no need

contents.culture: Heartbreaking moment—Hye-in has given up on having children (현연 글렀다 from earlier) due to her terminal illness.

contents.original: 실적이 안 나오면 상품 본부에서 좋은 브랜드를 유치할 수가 없다고. 왜 하나만 한 소리를 하지?
contents.pronunciation: Siljeok-i an naomyeon sangpum bonbu-eseo joeun beuraendeu-reul yuchihhal suga eopdago. Wae hanaman han sori-reul haji?
contents.translation: If we don't get results, the merchandise division can't attract good brands. Why do you keep saying the same thing?

grammar.example: 실적이 안 나오면 = if results don't come
브랜드를 유치할 수가 없다 = can't attract brands

contents.culture: Work stress bleeding into their marriage—Hye-in's constant focus on business.

contents.original: 제 짐들 이 방으로 옮겨주세요. 네? 침대 하나 놔주시고요. 당분간 여기서 지낼 겁니다.
contents.pronunciation: Je jim-deul i bang-euro omgyeojuseyo. Ne? Chimdae hana nwajusigoyo. Dangbungan yeogi-seo jinal geomnida.
contents.translation: Please move my things to this room. What? Put a bed in here. I'll be staying here for a while.

grammar.example: 제 짐들 = my things

grammar.explanation: Adverb meaning 'for the time being/for a while'
grammar.example: 당분간 여기서 = for a while here

contents.culture: Hye-in moving to sleep separately—the marriage is falling apart. She's moving into what was meant to be the baby's room.

contents.original: 울지 마. 그럴 자격 없어.
contents.pronunciation: Ulji ma. Geureol jagyeok eopseo.
contents.translation: Don't cry. You don't have the right to.

grammar.example: 울지 마 = don't cry
그럴 자격 없어 = no right to do that

contents.culture: Hyun-woo talking to himself—denying himself the right to be sad about the marriage falling apart, or perhaps struggling with guilt about his original divorce plan.

contents.original: 안 기다렸어. 내가 어젯밤 안 잤다고 해서 당신 기다렸다고 생각하지 마.
contents.pronunciation: An gidaryeosseo. Naega eojetbam an jatdago haeseo dangsin gidaryeotdago saenggak-haji ma.
contents.translation: I wasn't waiting. Just because I didn't sleep last night, don't think I was waiting for you.

grammar.example: 기다렸다고 생각하지 마 = don't think I was waiting

contents.culture: Classic tsundere moment—Hye-in denying that she waited up for Hyun-woo all night.

contents.original: 그렇게 생각 안 해. 들어가자. 추워.
contents.pronunciation: Geureoke saenggak an hae. Deureogaja. Chuwo.
contents.translation: I don't think that. Let's go inside. It's cold.

grammar.example: 추워 = it's cold

contents.original: 기다린 게 아니라 잠이 안 온 거야. 잠자리도 낯설고 동네 개들도 짖어대고 수면제도 안 가져왔고 그래서 잠 못 잔 거라고.
contents.pronunciation: Gidarin ge anira jam-i an on geoya. Jamjari-do natsеolgo dongne gae-deul-do jijeo-daego sumyeonje-do an gajeowatgo geuraeseo jam mot jan georago.
contents.translation: I wasn't waiting, I just couldn't sleep. The bed was unfamiliar, the neighborhood dogs kept barking, I didn't bring my sleeping pills—that's why I couldn't sleep.

grammar.example: 기다린 게 아니라 = not that I was waiting
잠자리도 낯설고 = the bed was unfamiliar
개들도 짖어대고 = dogs kept barking
수면제도 안 가져왔고 = didn't bring sleeping pills

contents.culture: Hye-in making excuses—listing every possible reason except the truth (that she was worried about him).

contents.original: 알았다잖아. 기다렸다고 생각 안 한다고. 네가 언제 나 기다린 적 있어?
contents.pronunciation: Aratdajana. Gidaryeotdago saenggak an handago. Nega eonje na gidarin jeok isseo?
contents.translation: I said I know. I said I don't think you were waiting. When have you ever waited for me?

grammar.example: 기다린 적 있어 = have you ever waited

contents.culture: Hyun-woo's bitter rhetorical question—implying Hye-in has never cared enough to wait for him.

contents.original: 맞아. 나는 원래 누구 기다리고 그런 사람 아니야.
contents.pronunciation: Maja. Na-neun wollae nugu gidarigo geureon saram aniya.
contents.translation: Right. I'm not the type of person who waits for anyone.

grammar.example: 원래 그런 사람 아니야 = I'm not that kind of person

contents.culture: Hye-in defensively agreeing—but her actions (staying up all night) contradict her words.

contents.original: 그래, 너 그런 사람 아닌 거 누구보다 내가 잘 알아.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae, neo geureon saram anin geo nuguboda naega jal ara.
contents.translation: Yeah, I know better than anyone that you're not that kind of person.

grammar.example: 누구보다 내가 잘 알아 = I know better than anyone

contents.culture: The most painful line—Hyun-woo confirming that he believes she doesn't care. Years of feeling unloved crystallized in one sentence.

contents.original: 우산이나 똑바로 들어. 알았으니까 빨리 들어가기는 하자고. 비 점점 쏟아지잖아. 감기 들고 싶어? 할 얘기 있으면 집에서 하자고.
contents.pronunciation: Usan-ina ttokbaro deureo. Arasseunnikka ppalli deureogagineun hajago. Bi jeomjeom ssodajijana. Gamgi deulgo sipeo? Hal yaegi isseumyeon jib-eseo hajago.
contents.translation: At least hold the umbrella properly. I said okay, so let's hurry inside. The rain is getting heavier. Want to catch a cold? If you have something to say, let's talk at home.

grammar.example: 우산이나 똑바로 들어 = at least hold the umbrella right
비 점점 쏟아지잖아 = the rain is pouring
감기 들고 싶어? = want to catch a cold?

contents.culture: Despite the tension, Hyun-woo still cares about her health—holding the umbrella for her in the rain.

contents.original: 나는 할 얘기 없거든.
contents.pronunciation: Na-neun hal yaegi eopgeodeun.
contents.translation: I have nothing to say.

grammar.example: 없거든 = because there isn't/I don't have any

contents.culture: Hye-in shutting down communication—the wall between them.

contents.original: 너 왜 비를 맞고 있어? 네가 여기 왜 있어? 일단 들어가서 얘기하자.
contents.pronunciation: Neo wae bi-reul matgo isseo? Nega yeogi wae isseo? Ildan deureogaseo yaegi-haja.
contents.translation: Why are you standing in the rain? Why are you here? Let's go inside and talk first.

grammar.example: 비를 맞고 있어 = standing in the rain
일단 들어가서 = let's go in first

contents.culture: Despite everything, they still care about each other—just unable to communicate.
